author: COMSOL
description: This model simulates the dynamic behavior of a slider crank mechanism with a clearance joint. All the components of the mechanism are assumed rigid. Two hinge joints are used to connect the support, crank, and connecting rod to each other. To model a joint between connecting rod and slider, two different cases are considered. First case assumes the connecting rodâ€“slider joint as a perfect hinge without any clearance. In the second case, a clearance joint is used which allows the connected components to move within the provided clearance distance. Transient analysis is performed to analyze the effect of joint clearance on slider velocity, slider acceleration, and crank moment.
label: slider_crank_mechanism_with_clearance.mph
